I think you might have to give me some more details.. what version of ubuntu are you using, which webserver were you using.. how do you know it's gone and so on
well.. you can run "lsb_release -a" in a terminal.. you might be able to check the help, about menu as well
Apache perhaps? there is no webserver installed by default.. at least not on the desktop install
are you running the regular desktop install? ie with the Gnome gui, pretty boot up logo and such.. or is it ubuntu server (no gui, just command line)
yea, you can try installing apache again.. either by using synaptic or apt-get.. either way will work
give it a try.. you might need to configure apache but give it a try.. see what happens
hmm.. can you pastebin the error? by text or screenshot.. either way is fine
hang on.. let me try installing emacs here on my system.. see if it does the same thing to me
ok, it worked on my machine.. but let's remove it and see if we can't get your apache working first
try running this in a terminal    "sudo dpkg --remove emacs22"
ok, do the same with this package as well    "sudo dpkg --remove emacs22-gtk"
then try this    "sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install"
hopefully it will just run through without any errors
I don't think so
ok, so apache is already installed.. perhaps it isn't configured yet
try this   "sudo service apache start"
try   sudo service apache2 start   instead
